title: Seems like Fiora may indeed be lesbian BTW
body:
In Swain's VO, he wonders how Fiora's suitors that she always declined never saw why.

Of course, this can as well mean she has nasty disease or is a man in disguise, but I think it was just a small pointing towards her sexuality.
When the Varus Apocalypse came, many people wondered why, If Riot wanted sexually non-standard character, they didn't choose "obvious gay characters" such as Vi or Fiora.

So I thought this may be interesting for some. It's hinted, not confirmed, she won't likely recieve any lore update so it's nothing enormous, but it's a little interesting note.

replies.body:
That's one possibility.  The other possibility, which is not mutually exclusive, is she does not want to give up her position as the head of her house, which would happen if she was to marry.

Demacia is highly structured, and going against the flow is a quick way to lose social standing.  Her house is already on thin ice considering the actions of her father...  Let's just say Fiora is in a very delicate situation.
Why would she have to give up her position if she married, does it mention in the lore? Is Demacia patriarchal?

Yep, Demacia is patriarchal.

> Some still speak of her House's disgrace or decry how standards have fallen that a woman should dare call herself ruler of a noble House, but only in private. For when such gossip reaches Fiora's ear, she is quick to call out those rumormongers and demand justice on the edge of a sword.

This is from Fiora's bio.

Not Demacia as a whole (though it is hinted) but House Laurent did try to force her into being only "someone else's wife". She refused it but it could have been her future.

However since now she is the head of her house, couldn't she just abolish family traditions ? 
Her whole position is really complicated though.
Nah, the quote that Redniwedis just linked shows that Demacia as a whole is patriarchal.
At least the nobility is, we haven't heard anything about the lower classes.
It's not a stretch to imagine they feel something similar, considering how they're about unity.
And how lower classes tend to take some trends from the higher class.

It's a roughly Medieval society, mostly drawn from our own history. OF COURSE IT IS! 

The other nations or places like the Freljord or Targon have a long history of needing strength in whatever form it could be found. Noxus has that whole "might makes right" thing (and with the old lore, magic and certainly cleverness was included under a form of... "intellectual might," you might say), the Freljord had three legendary female rulers who led a revolt and then split the tribes between (sort of), Yordles... uh, no idea, and Targon has had women chosen to be "Aspects" at about as often as men (the current split is actually 3 to 2 in favor of women, if Taric is an Aspect... I've forgotten at this late hour).

That leaves Bilgewater.... female pirates able to terrorize just as well as the men? More prevalent firearms proved that old saying "God created man, but Sam Colt made them equal"? Their own, mini-version of Noxus society, they are just too independent to follow one ruler for too long?

> It's a roughly Medieval society, mostly drawn from our own history. OF COURSE IT IS!

That's the assumption I made, but I wanted support from canon lore before I considered the plausibility of RedniwediS' explanation. Which he thankfully linked me. 

Having said that, despite Demacia being patriarchal, women are still treated more equally than in Earth's medieval societies. For instance, women can achieve high positions in military. Ex) One of Garen's elite crew is a woman. This, along with the excerpt RednwediS linked me, leads me to believe that Demacia is where the we (Norther Americans) were in the 1960s - 80s in terms of gender equality. What I mean by this is that, women are still clearly treated worse than men, but it's still possible for extraordinary women to overcome this adversity.

Queen Elizabeth I and her cousin Mary, Queen of Scots, Joan of Arc, Queen Victoria, Sacagawea, Pocahontas, Cleopatra, Hatshepsut, any of the female pirates, any of the women who pretended to be men to become soldiers, Athena, Kali, Isis. Women from all periods of history (and a couple mythological) who were just as powerful (if not more than) any of the boys.

Ancient Greece had the story of the a nation of women who wanted to change a certain law and refused to sleep with all of their husbands until it was changed (it was changed pretty quick).

I very much doubt that "women" as a whole were as powerless as some people make them out to be, even if the laws of the time specifically forbade them from certain things, there are always ways around laws. If nothing else, they could badger their husbands to do something until he agreed to it. If it works nowadays, I don't see why it wouldn't work 500 years ago.

^^ Yeah I think this is a lot more likely.

I like to think I haven’t really discussed the issue with anyone who’s open to new ideas.  So far I’ve only really engaged with one specific type of entrenched idiot.

One sec I'm finding a link. _Edit, link is going to take longer to find, I'll post a fresh reply with it for you when I find it._

That’s great, and I’m glad you’ve managed to remain optimistic in the ability for fellow man to change his ways. I think the people more likely to be swayed are the ones who haven’t made their minds up yet, these may be the people just simply reading, never discussing themselves. 

Oftentimes you’ll see people who are “just asking questions” when what they’re really doing is making thinly veiled racial statements and claiming ignorance on their part.  They will then often claim that in fact they are the real victims. 

The real victims here are lgbt people who already have it rough in real life.  I don’t care much if I offend the feelings of Internet homophobes uncomfortable with their favorite pastime moving beyond them. The same stuff happens in comics as well. 

If Riot as a company produced poor-quality stories, and I felt that they wouldn’t be able to handle an LGBT character well, I wouldn’t be arguing the position I am.  I also wouldn’t be remotely as interested in the lore. 

That being said, I think Riot handles stories well and they can make complex characters with interesting motivations and room for development. 

Finally, I refuse to treat homophobia as a logical, rational viewpoint.  Bigotry is never founded in ethical intellectualism. Bigotry stems from pseudo-science and fear-mongering.  That group of people relies heavily on dishonestly changing the frames of debate.   They are stupid people, with hateful views, who should get off the internet and earnestly reflect on their beliefs.  They won’t. They have no reason to change their views. 

I’d rather the LoLboards not become another festering pit of Internet-chauvinism.

And fans like you just wanting to make her gay because you biased only makes that worse. That makes it look like "I really don't care what they do, just make sure she's gay.OK!"

So you’re operating of the belief that Riot is unable to create a character with nuance while also making her lesbian. I’ll say that I disagree entirely.  I firmly believe that if they chose to explore it, they could very much develop her as a character while also being a lesbian.  

Besides, Demacia exists in a medieval-renaissance weird state full of random anomalies.  I doubt such defined labels as Lesbian or Gay would even exist. You can even argue that sexual openness is one of the defining features of that period of time. There have been English Kong’s known to “know the company” of both men and women. 

I believe that Riot can make fiora into a character who spurs social change in Demacia.  Fiora’s sexuality is ultimately unimportant in this respect.  She could even be bisexual as Warlord hunted. 

It’s interesting that you’re continuing to attack fans who are fine with the idea of a lesbian fiora as people fanatically pushing for some sort of ideology.  This is (largely) not the case.  While there are a few lobbying for a more aggressive inclusion of minorities in LoL, I like to think that most people will be able to accept the sexuality of their favorite characters being revealed as non-conforming. 

Personally, I think that if Riot were to confirm Fiora’s sexual non-conformity then we as fans will get to see how that subject gets explored in the society of Demacia.  We may get a glimpse at Demacian religion/spirituality.  

If they decide to confirm that she is strictly hetero (which I doubt they’d do for anyone) I can’t say I wouldn’t be saddened. Ultimately the story’s integrity wouldn’t be relying on her sexuality anyhow. 

Riot has shown that they can create multi-faceted, complex characters with interesting motivations and room for development. They wouldn’t throw all of that out of the window to turn Fiora into the SJW boogeyman that so many apparently fear.
